definition: to compensate for working on a holiday by resting on a workday/to compensate for resting on a workday by working on a holiday
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: But unfortunately, it didn't often work out.
sentences.chinese: 但是很不幸，调休经常很难实现。

sentences.english: Tracks yearly vacation, overtime compensation, sick leave and other leave information.
sentences.chinese: 管理和追踪年假，调休，病假和其他假期信息。

sentences.english: Confusion aside, many Chinese resent having to pay back some of their vacation days.
sentences.chinese: 困惑之余，许多中国人对“调休政策”表示了不满。

sentences.english: The company decided to delay its rest days due to heavy business.
sentences.chinese: 由于最近业务繁忙，公司决定调休。

sentences.english: Engineer Zhao is on holiday shift now, because he hadn't had a holiday for six months.
sentences.chinese: 赵工程师现在在调休中，他已经六个月没有休假了。

sentences.english: The class fills to whether must be after tone rests complemental that month, lie between a month to disable?
sentences.chinese: 调休后补班是否必须在当月补足，隔月无效？

definition: to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to have a holiday or vacation
to take deferred time off (to make up for working during the weekend or holidays)/compensatory leave
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
leave of absence for a personal matter
